name: breadstuff
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] any type of bread: He went to the buffet table and began selecting a breadstuff for his plate. Often, breadstuffs would be scarce before the next harvest was ready.
[ C or U ] any flour or grain used for making bread: Wheat was used as a breadstuff principally by the wealthy, and maize by the poor. Our breadstuff had run out so I went to buy some barley for soup.
More examplesFewer examplesThey save the leftover bread, rolls, and muffins for the chickens instead of tossing the stale breadstuffs.Barmbrack is an Irish yeasted breadstuff loaded with sultanas and raisins.I love sourdough, that pleasantly acidic breadstuff.At that time, crops were deficient, and breadstuffs were imported.
